text: The European Film Award for Best Supporting Actor was awarded by the European Film Academy to actors of European language films. It ran from 1988 to 1992. ==Winners and nominees== ===Awards by Years=== {| class="wikitable" width="95%" cellpadding="5" |- !width="100"|Year !width="300"|Winner and nominees !width="300"|Film |- |rowspan="5" style="text-align:center;"|1988 (1st)||style="background:#B0C4DE;"| Curt Bois||style="background:#B0C4DE;"|Wings of Desire |- | Björn Granath||Pelle the Conqueror |- | Ray McBride||Reefer and the Model |- | Wojciech Pszoniak||Notturno |- | Helgi Skulason||Shadow of the Raven |- | style="text- align:center;"|1989 (2nd)||colspan="3"|no award given, see European Film Award for Best Supporting Performance |- |rowspan="3" style="text-align:center;"|1990 (3rd)||style="background:#B0C4DE;"| Dmitri Pevtsov||style="background:#B0C4DE;"|Mother |- | Björn Kjellman||The Guardian Angel |- | Gabino Diego||¡Ay Carmela! |- |rowspan="3" style="text- align:center;"|1991 (4th)||style="background:#B0C4DE;"| Ricky Memphis||style="background:#B0C4DE;"|Ultra |- | Zbigniew Zamachowski||Escape from the 'Liberty' Cinema |- | Ricky Tomlinson||Riff-Raff |- |rowspan="3" style="text-align:center;"|1992 (5th)||style="background:#B0C4DE;"| André Wilms||style="background:#B0C4DE;"|La Vie de Bohème |- | Väino Laes||Peace Street |- | Ernst-Hugo Järegård||Europa |- | style="text-align:center;"|after 1992 ||colspan="3" style="text-align:center;"| award discontinued |- |} ==See also== * BAFTA Award for Best Supporting Actor * César Award for Best Supporting Actor * David di Donatello for Best Supporting Actor * Goya Award for Best Supporting Actor * Polish Academy Award for Best Supporting Actor ==External links== *European Film Academy archive Supporting Actor Category:Film awards for supporting actor Category:Awards established in 1988 Category:1988 establishments in Europe Category:Former awards
title: European Film Award for Best Supporting Actor
